page.title: 11INTRODUCTION
page.content: {Situation-}Pennine area of West Yorkshire.Two main settlements Marsden and Slaithwaite.Marsden has a population of 5,000 and Slaithwaite 5,600. Two small streams the Wessenden and the Haigh rise high up on the Pennine hills near the Greater Manchester/West Yorkshire border and flow down to form the River Colne in Marsden.In 1985 the area is administered by the Metropolitan Borough of Kirklees from the large town of Huddersfield 7 miles to the North East of Marsden.Prior to local government re-organisation the area was part of the West Riding County Council administrative centre Slaithwaite. The area is semi-rural.The main settlements are crowded into the valley bottoms. The steep-sided valley is farmed with poor grazing for sheep on the hill-tops.
